Posts.Content: Nov 8, 2007 01:23AM kiwikan wrote: Well - I certainly didn't want to read this!  I had right breast rexcision on Oct 15 and will start rads on Monday.  It is quite swollen and there's alot of serum collected.  I'm told by both the surgeon and the rad onc that it's no problem.  It's been recommended that i don't have it drained.  I will decide that after i'm done with rads.  I was just told in the chat room that radiation is a piece of cake.  Well, if it is chocolate then ok.  But, seriously, I don't view having radiation as anything to be taken lightly.  I read comment that docs aren't willing to be forthright so as not to instill fear.  I chose lumpectomy AND rad.  I would not have only lumpectomy without radiation.  Cheers, Ruth
